headline: HR
summary: Experienced Human Resources Assistant with a demonstrated history of working in the law enforcement industry. Skilled in Negotiation, Microsoft Excel, Customer Service, Strategic Planning, and Microsoft Office. Strong human resources professional with a Bachelors in Liberal Studies focused in Social Sciences from Rutgers University â Camden.

defaultPosition.description:
â¢	Assisting with the day to day operations for Human Resource Support Services for the Dallas, TX Service Centers of the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), Immigration and Customs Enforcement, to support Human Resources Operational Staffing Activities.
â¢	Interpreting and applying laws, rules and regulations including: Executive Orders, Delegated Examining Unit (DEU) regulations, Vet Guide and all other appropriate policies and regulations.
â¢	Addressing applicant and internal customer issues by providing status updates of their applications. 
â¢	Responding to applicant inquires by phone and email. Creating vacancy folders for each job announcement.
â¢	Scanning documents into various personnel record systems
â¢	Researching and compiling information on the full range of federal HR topics; responding to and providing general HR guidance to applicants and staff
â¢	Initiating pre-employment processes such as security, medical, drug, and or fitness test as necessary. Coordinating job offers and the setting of entry-on duty dates
â¢	Completing an array of weekly and quarterly hiring status reports, as requested. Maintaining, updating, and operating several independent processing systems. Reviewing and verifying recruitment and staffing documents and files.
â¢	Preparing reports utilizing different software programs Create and maintain databases and spreadsheets.
â¢	Track key dates and deadlines and maintained specific personnel lists. Screen all applicants based on their qualifications and background.
defaultPosition.title: HR Assistant CRT
